info.title: Partner Referrals
info.description:
Deprecation notice: This integration method is deprecated. PayPal continues to support existing merchants using this method, but be advised that new features and enhancements will not be applied to these integrations. For details, see Onboard Sellers.
Partners can use the Partner Referrals API to add PayPal seller accounts using the before payment onboarding model. With this API, you collect seller data and pass it to the account creation and setup forms, reducing the burden on sellers during the signup and setup process.

post.description: Creates a partner referral that is shared by the API caller. The referrals contains the client's personal, business, and financial data.

201.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `201 Created` status code and a JSON response body that contains a [HATEOAS link](/docs/api/reference/api-responses/#hateoas-links) to show the referral data and an `action_url` to which you redirect the customer in a browser to complete the signup process. The `partner_referral_id` token is appended to the URL.

get.description: Shows details for referral data, by ID, that was shared by the API caller.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `200 OK` status code and a JSON response body that shows referral data.

get.description: Lists sellers that a partner onboarded, by partner ID.

201.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `201 Created` status code and a JSON response body that lists sellers. For each seller, the response shows the seller ID (`merchant_id`), the tracking ID, and [HATEOAS links](/docs/api/reference/api-responses/#hateoas-links) to show the seller-partner information.

get.description: Shows status information for sellers that the partner on-boards, by partner ID.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `200 OK` status code and a JSON response body that shows status details.

get.description: Fetches merchant credentials for a merchant onboarded through downloadable cart flow.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `200 OK` status code and a JSON response body that shows merchant credentials.

tags.name: merchant-integration
tags.description: Enables you to get information about a seller-partner integration.

tags.name: partner-referrals
tags.description: Enables you to create and get information about shared customer data.

tags.name: partner-referral-link
tags.description: Links partner-referral data with a PayPal account.

tags.name: cancel-onboarding
tags.description: Enables you to cancel an in-progress seller onboarding.

scopes.https://uri.paypal.com/services/customer: Manage external referral data with PayPal
Manage referral data shared by Partner with PayPal. To be used by only internal apps

partner_referral_id.name: partner_referral_id
partner_referral_id.description: Filters the links in the response by this partner referral ID.

partner_id.name: partner_id
partner_id.description: The ID of the partner for which to show onboarded seller's credentials, which is the partner's PayPal account number. To find this ID, log in to the partner's PayPal business account. Navigate to **Profile**, click **Profile and settings**, and click **My business info**. The account number appears in the **Merchant account ID** section.

tracking_id.name: tracking_id
tracking_id.description: Filters the sellers in the response by this partner-provided seller ID (`merchant_id`).

merchant_id.name: merchant_id
merchant_id.description: The ID of the seller for which to show status information.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: Filters the fields in the response to this comma-separated list of fields.

error_details.title: Error Details
error_details.description: The error details. Required for client-side `4XX` errors.

field.description: The field that caused the error. If this field is in the body, set this value to the field's JSON pointer value. Required for client-side errors.

value.description: The value of the field that caused the error.

location.description: The location of the field that caused the error. Value is `body`, `path`, or `query`.

issue.description: The unique, fine-grained application-level error code.

description.description: The human-readable description for an issue. The description can change over the lifetime of an API, so clients must not depend on this value.

enum: Request is not well-formed, syntactically incorrect, or violates schema.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

enum: Authentication failed due to missing authorization header, or invalid authentication credentials.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

enum: Authorization failed due to insufficient permissions.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

enum: The specified resource does not exist.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

enum: The server has detected a conflict while processing this request.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

enum: The server does not support the request payload's media type.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

enum: The requested action could not be performed, semantically incorrect, or failed business validation.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

email_address.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.

prefix.description: The prefix, or title, to the party's name.

given_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's given, or first, name.

surname.description: When the party is a person, the party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name. Required when the party is a person. Use also to store multiple surnames including the matronymic, or mother's, surname.

middle_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's middle name. Use also to store multiple middle names including the patronymic, or father's, middle name.

suffix.description: The suffix for the party's name.

alternate_full_name.description: DEPRECATED. The party's alternate name. Can be a business name, nickname, or any other name that cannot be split into first, last name. Required when the party is a business.

full_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's full name.

phone.title: Phone
phone.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).

country_code.description: The country calling code (CC), in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the CC and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

national_number.description: The national number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

phone_details.description: The phone number and the phone type.
phone_details.title: Phone Details

country_code.description:
The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

address.title: Simple Postal Address (Coarse-Grained)
address.description: A simple postal address with coarse-grained fields. Do not use for an international address. Use for backward compatibility only. Does not contain phone.

line1.description: The first line of the address. For example, number or street.

line2.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.

state.description: The [code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/) for a US state or the equivalent for other countries. Required for transactions if the address is in one of these countries: [Argentina](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#argentina), [Brazil](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#brazil), [Canada](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#canada), [China](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#china), [India](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#india), [Italy](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#italy), [Japan](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#japan), [Mexico](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#mexico), [Thailand](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#thailand), or [United States](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#usa). Maximum length is 40 single-byte characters.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).

identity_document_type.title: Identity Document Type
identity_document_type.description: The identifier type in the onboarding domain. Indicates the most specific type or the closest matching value. For example, SOCIAL_SECURITY_NUMBER in preference to TAX_IDENTIFICATION_NUMBER.

identity_document.title: Identity Document
identity_document.description: The authority-issued identification document. Document types include a driver's license, social security number, employee ID number, and so on.

value.description: The identifier value, such as license number, social security number, and so on.

partial_value.description: Indicates whether the value is a partial value. Specify this value when the identifier type supports a partial value, such as four SSN digits instead of the full nine values. Depending on the context, this parameter can be ignored.

issuer_country_code.description: The [two-character ISO-3166-1 country code](/docs/api/reference/country-codes/) for the country that issued the document.

account_owner_relationship.title: Seller Account Relationship
account_owner_relationship.description: The familial relationship of the seller account owner.

name.description: The name of the familial relation.

country_code_of_nationality.description: The nationality of the familial relation.

email_address.description: The primary email address of the account.

name.description: The legal name of the customer.

phone_contacts.description: An array of contact phone numbers for the customer.

home_address.description: The home address of the account holder.

nationality_country_code.description: The [two-character ISO-3166-1 country code](/docs/api/reference/country-codes/) for the nationality of the account holder. Can include one of the PayPal-supported countries.

identity_documents.description: An array of documents that uniquely identify the user, such as a license number, social security number, and so on.

account_owner_relationships.description: An array of familial relationships that are attached to a seller.

business_sub_type.description: Sub classification of the business type.
business_sub_type.title: Business sub-type

purpose_code_enum.title: Purpose Code
purpose_code_enum.description:
The purpose code. Required only for India. For more information, see the Reserve Bank Of India web site. Value is:
  • P0104. Cross border delivery of goods and services.
  • P0301. Business related travel purchase.
  • P0801. Hardware consulting.
  • P0802. Software consulting.
  • P0803. Data processing consulting.
  • P0805. Freelance journalism.
  • P0806. Other information services.
  • P0902. Licensing revenues.
  • P1004. Legal.
  • P1005. Accounting and tax.
  • P1006. Business and management consultancy.
  • P1007. Advertising and market research.
  • P1008. Research and development.
  • P1009. Architectural services.

business_name.title: Business Name
business_name.description: A name for the business. For example, the legal name or the stock-trading name.

type.description: The legal category of the business.

events_type.title: Events Type
events_type.description: The event type for an onboarding entity.

date_of_event.title: Date of Event
date_of_event.description: The date for an event type. Typically captured during onboarding.

event_date.description: The date portion of the date and time when the event occurred, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). For accuracy, if you do not know the exact time zone, use the UTC time zone.

value.description: The amount, up to _`N`_ digits after the decimal separator. For currencies that do not support decimals, see [currency codes](/docs/api/reference/currency-codes/).

currency_range.title: Currency Range
currency_range.description: The currency range, from the minimum inclusive amount to the maximum inclusive amount.

minimum_amount.description: The minimum inclusive amount for the range.

maximum_amount.description: The maximum inclusive amount for the range.

email_contact.title: Email Contact
email_contact.description: The email address. Includes the role of the email address.

role.description: The role of the email address.

name.description: The legal name of the customer.

phone_contacts.description: An array of contact phone numbers for the customer.

home_address.description: The home address of the account holder.

nationality_country_code.description: The citizenship country code of the person

individual_beneficial_owner.title: Individual_beneficial_owner
individual_beneficial_owner.description: The individual owner of the account.

percentage_of_ownership.description: The percentage of shares this person owns in the company.

phone_contacts.description: An array of phone contacts for the business.

business_subtype.description: The sub classification of business type.

category.description: The customer's business category code. PayPal uses the industry standard seller category codes.

sub_category.description: The customer's business subcategory code. PayPal uses the industry standard seller category codes.

merchant_category_code.description: The customer's business seller category code. PayPal uses the industry standard seller category codes.

website_urls.description: An array of website URLs for the business.

items.description: The URL for the business website.

annual_sales_volume_range.description: The range for the total annual sales volume of the business.

average_monthly_volume_range.description: The range for the average monthly volume of the business.

business_beneficial_owner.title: Business_beneficial_owner
business_beneficial_owner.description: The individual owner of the account.

percentage_of_ownership.description: The percentage of shares this person owns in the company.

office_bearer_role.description: Role of the person party played in the business.
office_bearer_role.title: Role type

office_bearer.title: Office_bearer
office_bearer.description: The office bearers of the account.

role.description: The role of the person in the company.

phone_contacts.description: An array of phone contacts for the business.

category.description: The customer's business category code. PayPal uses the industry standard seller category codes.

sub_category.description: The customer's business subcategory code. PayPal uses the industry standard seller category codes.

merchant_category_code.description: The customer's business seller category code. PayPal uses the industry standard seller category codes.

business_description.description: The business goals description. For example, a mission statement.

event_dates.description: An array of event dates for the business.

website_urls.description: An array of website URLs for the business.

items.description: The URL for the business website.

annual_sales_volume_range.description: The range for the total annual sales volume of the business.

average_monthly_volume_range.description: The range for the average monthly volume of the business.

identity_documents.description: An array of identity documents that uniquely identify the user. For example, a license number, social security number, and so on.

email_contacts.description: An array of contact email addresses for the company.

country_of_incorporation.description: The country code of the country where the business was incorporated.

beneficial_owners.description: List of beneficial owners part of the entity. They can be either a Person or a business entity.

office_bearers.description: List of office bearers as part of the business entity.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description:
The attributes for an instrument institute ID. Used with the account number to uniquely identify the instrument. Value is:
  • For banks with IBAN information, the IBAN number.
  • For banks with BBAN information, the BBAN number.
  • For banks with both IBAN and BBAN information, the IBAN number.

bank_details.title: Bank Details
bank_details.description: The required information to add a card as a financial instrument to PayPal through onboarding.

nick_name.description: The user-provided short name for the user's bank account.

account_number.description: The bank account number. These are numeric values only without any additional formatting.

account_type.description: The type of account, which is checking or savings.

currency_code.description: The primary [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/api/reference/currency-codes/) for the account.

identifiers.description:
An array of instrument institute attributes. Used with the account number to uniquely identify the instrument. Value is:
  • For banks with IBAN information, the IBAN number.
  • For banks with BBAN information, the BBAN number.
  • For banks with both IBAN and BBAN information, the IBAN number.

mandate_agreed.description: Indicates whether the user has agreed to the mandate for financial instrument (FI) authorization.

account_identifier.title: Account Identifier
account_identifier.description: The PayPal account ID of the partner.

type.description: The type of ID for the account.

partner_specific_identifiers.title: Partner Identifiers
partner_specific_identifiers.description: The identifier for the customer in the partner's system.

user.title: User
user.description: The customer's business and personal data that is required to create an account.

customer_type.description: The type of PayPal account to create, which is consumer or seller.

financial_instrument_data.title: Financial Instrument Data
financial_instrument_data.description: The customer's financial instrument. Use it to add a financial instrument to the customer's PayPal account.

bank_details.description: An array of bank account details for the `ADD_BANK` capability.

preferred_language_code.title: Preferred Language Code
preferred_language_code.description: The locale code of the user's preferred language.

primary_currency_code.description: The primary [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/api/reference/currency-codes/) of the account.

partner_specific_identifiers.description: An array of customer identifiers in the partner's system.

integration_details.title: Integration Details
integration_details.description: The integration details for the partner and customer relationship. Required if `capability_type` is `API_INTEGRATION`.

partner_id.description: The payer ID of the partner who integrates with the client. To find this ID, log in to the partner's PayPal business account. Navigate to Profile, click Profile and settings, and click My business info. The account number appears in the Merchant account ID section.

rest_api_integration.title: REST API Integration
rest_api_integration.description: The integration details for PayPal REST endpoints.

integration_type.title: Integration Type
integration_type.description: The type of REST-endpoint integration. To integrate with Braintree v.zero for PayPal REST endpoints, specify `REST_THIRD_PARTY_DETAILS`.

rest_third_party_details.title: REST Third-Party Details
rest_third_party_details.description: The integration details for PayPal REST endpoints.

partner_client_id.description: The client ID of the partner's API caller account.

feature_list.description: An array of features that partner can access, or use, in PayPal on behalf of the seller. The seller grants permission for these features to the partner.

rest_first_party_details.title: REST First-Party Details
rest_first_party_details.description: The integration details for PayPal First Party REST endpoints.

partner_client_id.description: The client ID of the partner.

feature_list.description: An array of features that partner can access, or use, in PayPal on behalf of the seller. The seller grants permission for these features to the partner.

seller_nonce.description: S256 - The code verifier must be high-entropy cryptographic random string with a byte length of 43-128 range.

billing_experience_preference.title: Billing Experience Preference
billing_experience_preference.description: The preference that customizes the billing experience of the customer.

experience_id.description: The ID of the payment web experience profile, which is returned from a [create web experience profile](/docs/api/payment-experience/v1/#web-profiles_create) call.

billing_context_set.description: Indicates whether the partner has already displayed the billing context to the seller.

billing_agreement.title: Billing Agreement
billing_agreement.description: The details of the billing agreement between the partner and a seller.

merchant_custom_data.description: The custom data for the billing agreement.

approval_url.description: The URL to which to redirect seller to accept the billing agreement.

ec_token.description: The billing agreement token for the agreement.

capabilities.title: Capability
capabilities.description: The required capability to share data.

capability.description: The capability to enable for the customer. To enable the collection of the API permissions that you require to integrate with the customer, specify `API_INTEGRATION`. `BANK_ADDITION` is supported only for the US.

web_experience_preference.title: Web Experience Preference
web_experience_preference.description: The preference to customize the web experience of the customer.

partner_logo_url.description:
The partner logo URL to display in the seller onboarding flow.
Note: While there is no restriction on the size of your image, PayPal forces the max width to 106px and max height to 29px. The best resolution you can provide is 106px x 29px.

return_url.description: The URL to which to redirect the customer upon completion of the onboarding process.

return_url_description.description: The description of the return URL.

action_renewal_url.description: If `renew_action_url` expires, redirect the customer to this URL.

show_add_credit_card.description: Indicates whether to show an add credit card page.

show_mobile_confirm.description: Indicates whether to ask the customer to initiate confirmation of their mobile phone (the phone that the partner designated as `MOBILE` in the customer data). Default is`false`.

use_mini_browser.description: Indicates whether to provide a single page signup flow in a mini browser. Default is to provide a full-size, multi-page flow.

use_hua_email_confirmation.description: Indicates whether to use the `hosted_user_agreement_url` to confirm the customer's email address. If `true`, PayPal appends the email confirmation code to `hosted_user_agreement_url`, and when a customer successfully accesses the hosted user agreement URL, confirms the customer's email address. If `false`, PayPal does not append the confirmation code to the URL and does not confirm the email address.

type.description: The type of consent. `SHARE_DATA_CONSENT` gives consent to you to share your customer's data with PayPal.

granted.description: Indicates whether the customer agreed to share this type of data. To give consent, specify `true`. To withhold consent, specify `false`.

product_name.description: The PayPal product for which the customer is onboarded.
product_name.title: Product Name

referral_data.title: Referral Data
referral_data.description: The referral data that partners share with PayPal.

requested_capabilities.description: An array of capabilities to enable for the customer while he or she shares the data.

collected_consents.description: An array of all consents that the partner has received from this seller. If `SHARE_DATA_CONSENT` is not granted, PayPal does not store customer data.

products.description: An array of PayPal products to which the partner wants to onboard the customer.

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this [URI Template-formatted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) link. For pre-processing, include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

rel.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.

partner_referral_id.description: The ID to access the customer's data shared by the partner with PayPal.

submitter_payer_id.description: The payer ID of the partner who shared the referral data.

vetting_status.description: The risk vetting status of product, if applicable.

status.description: The status of product bundle, if applicable.

capabilities.description: An array of the capability names bundled in the parent product.

signature.title: Signature
signature.description: The signature portion of the seller credentials.

api_user_name.description: The API user name of the seller.

api_password.description: The API password of the seller.

signature.description: The signature credential of the seller.

api_user_name.description: The API user name for the seller.

api_password.description: The API password for the seller.

download_link.description: The URL to download the certificate.

oauth-third-party.title: OAuth Third Party
oauth-third-party.description: The seller third-party information for REST API.

partner_client_id.description: The client ID of the partner's API caller account.

merchant_client_id.description: The client ID of the seller.

scopes.description: An array of scopes that the seller granted the partner.

access_token.description: The access token for the partner-selected integration method.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token for the partner-selected integration method.

oauth-integration.title: OAuth Integration
oauth-integration.description: The status of the oauth-integration between a partner and seller.

integration_type.description: The type of integration between the partner and the seller.

integration_method.description: The integration method that the partner uses to integrate with PayPal APIs.

oauth_third_party.description: An array of combinations of `partner_client_id` and `merchant_client_id` values and their associated scopes.

limitation.title: Limitation
limitation.description: The limitations on a seller account.

name.description: The title of the limitation that is applied to the account.

restrictions.description: An array of the restriction names.

limits.description: An array of limitations on the capability.

merchant-integration.title: Seller Integration
merchant-integration.description: The `merchant-integration` status information for a partner.

tracking_id.description: The partner-provided tracking ID, if one was provided.

merchant_id.description: The payer ID of the seller after creation of their PayPal account.

products.description: An array of all products that are integrated with the partner for the seller.

payments_receivable.description: Indicates whether the seller account can receive payments.

primary_email_confirmed.description: Indicates whether the primary email of the seller has been confirmed.

primary_email.description: The primary email address of the seller.

date_created.description: The date when the seller account was created, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

granted_permissions.description: An array of permissions granted to the partner by the seller.

items.description: The permission granted to the partner.

api_credentials.description: The API credentials of the seller.

oauth_integrations.description: An array of information about OAuth integrations between partners and sellers.

limitations.description: An array of limitations on the seller account.

capabilities.description: An array of capabilities associated with the products integrated between seller and partner.

merchant-integration.credentials.title: Seller Credentials
merchant-integration.credentials.description: The `merchant-integration` merchant credentials for a downloadable cart seller.

client_id.description: The client ID of the seller.

client_secret.description: The client secret of the seller.

payer_id.description: The payer ID of the seller and the pattern is not provided because the value is defined by an external party.
